page.title: 07THE RAILWAY NEAR HOBY - 1
page.content:
The railway that runs through Hoby valley is not very old.The railway from London,St.Pancras to Leicester that went on to Nottingham or Derby via Syston junction to the north was built before the line to Melton,via Hoby,had even been thought about.
Soon after a line was planned to go through Melton Mowbray from Peterborough via Stamford, Oakham & arrive at Syston. This made Syston very important to the L.M.S. Company. So then people travelling from London, St. Pancras could go to Melton Mowbray & Peterborough.
Other stations were built between Syston & Melton they were Brooksby, Asfordby & Frisby. All have now been closed down.
